column2: Po's love for noodles is the most relatable thing ever. A true foodie icon.
The moment the Dragon Scroll is just a reflective surface, meaning the power was in you all along... genius writing.
The Furious Five are all so cool, but my favorite is definitely Tigress. She's a beast.
Tai Lung's escape from prison was one of the most epic animated scenes I've ever seen. He just dismantled an entire army.
The animation in this movie is just beautiful. The style is so unique.
The Wuxi Finger Hold being a real move that just makes things go 'skadoosh' is the ultimate payoff.
Master Shifu has zero chill at the beginning of this movie. The guy needs a vacation.
The final fight between Po and Tai Lung, with Po using his 'flabby' style, is both hilarious and awesome.
'Yesterday is history, tomorrow is a mystery, but today is a gift. That is why it is called the present.' - Oogway is the GOAT.
I can't believe the entire prophecy hinged on Oogway pointing at a panda who fell out of the sky.
The training sequences are so creative and funny. Especially the one with the dumplings.
The secret ingredient of the secret ingredient soup being 'nothing' was the perfect parallel to the Dragon Scroll.
This movie has such a great message about believing in yourself.
Po defeating Tai Lung not with a magic power, but by understanding himself, is peak storytelling.
The dynamic between Po and his dad is so wholesome.
The moment Po is chosen as the Dragon Warrior and everyone's reaction is priceless.
The score in this movie absolutely slaps. Hans Zimmer is a legend.
Shifu's backstory with Tai Lung adds so much emotional weight to their conflict.
The Furious Five getting absolutely wrecked by Tai Lung really raises the stakes.
Po turning his biggest weakness (his size and love for food) into his greatest strength is so inspiring.
The animation style of the opening dream sequence is so cool.
The final 'skadoosh' is one of the most satisfying finishing moves in movie history.
I love how they portray the different styles of kung fu with the animals.
The fact that the Dragon Warrior was chosen by pure accident is hilarious.
Po's journey from a clumsy noodle maker to a legit hero is amazing.
The way Po uses the noodle cart to his advantage in the final fight is so clever.
The movie is just pure fun and has a lot of heart.
The moment the Furious Five finally respect Po is so earned.
The 'Stairs of Doom' are my worst nightmare.
Po using the Wuxi Finger Hold on Tai Lung was the ultimate uno reverse card.
The visual gags in this movie are top-tier.
Shifu finding inner peace after Po's victory brings the whole story full circle.
The character designs are so memorable and expressive.
The way Po defeats Tai Lung by being immune to his nerve attacks because he's 'too fat' is comedy gold.
The movie is a perfect blend of action, comedy, and emotion.
The secret of the Dragon Scroll being a metaphor for self-belief is a brilliant twist.
Jack Black was born to play Po. Perfect casting.
Tai Lung's motivation, feeling betrayed by Shifu, makes him a great and tragic villain.
The whole film is about turning your perceived weaknesses into strengths.
The reveal that there is no secret ingredient is the key to Po understanding the Dragon Scroll.
The fight on the rope bridge is an incredible action sequence.
The moment Shifu finally believes in Po is a huge turning point for both characters.
The Valley of Peace is such a beautiful setting.
The end credits with the hand-drawn animation are a nice touch.
A classic animated film that holds up perfectly.
Tai Lung's nerve attack having no effect on Po is the moment the tables truly turn.
The way Po uses his environment and his own body to fight is so unique.
The film's message that anyone can be a hero is timeless.
The dynamic between the Furious Five is so well done.
The reveal of the Dragon Scroll's true nature is a perfect subversion of the 'chosen one' trope.
The humor is so well-balanced with the more serious moments.
Po using food as a motivation to train is the most relatable thing I've ever seen.
The movie is a celebration of finding your own path.
The Dragon Scroll being blank is a twist that completely redefines the story.
The action choreography is amazing, especially for an animated film.
The final scene of Po and Shifu finding peace together is a perfect ending.
The movie is just a feel-good story with a lot of depth.
The way Po weaponizes his 'soft belly' to defeat Tai Lung is hilarious.
The voice cast is stacked and everyone is perfect in their role.
The ending proves that there is no secret ingredient to specialness.
A visually stunning film with a great story.
The 'skadoosh' moment is an all-timer. So simple, so effective.
The movie is a love letter to martial arts films.
The final fight is a perfect showcase of how much Po has grown.
The themes of destiny and choice are explored so well.
The Dragon Scroll is one of the best MacGuffins in movie history because of what it represents.
The movie is full of charm and wit.
Po realizing he's been doing kung fu his whole life (to get food) is a great 'aha' moment.
The film is a classic for a reason. It's just perfectly executed.
The final 'skadoosh' is the ultimate move because it's not about power, but about belief.
The character development of both Po and Shifu is fantastic.
The moment the scroll is revealed to be a mirror is the thematic climax of the film.
The movie is a hilarious and heartwarming journey of self-discovery.
Tai Lung's defeat is so satisfying because it's his own arrogance that beats him.
The art direction is just stunning.
The way the film subverts expectations of what a hero should be is brilliant.
The training scenes are some of the most memorable in any animated movie.
The revelation of the scroll's secret is the key to unlocking Po's true potential.
A masterpiece of animated storytelling.
The final battle is a perfect example of brains over brawn, or in Po's case, belly over brawn.
The movie has a timeless quality that makes it rewatchable.
The 'secret ingredient soup' subplot is a perfect parallel to the main story.
The film is just a joy to watch from beginning to end.
The Wuxi Finger Hold being a bluff that Po turns into a reality is the ultimate power move.
The emotional core of the film is the relationship between Po and Shifu.
The Dragon Scroll being a reflection of the one who reads it is a profound message.
The movie is a perfect blend of humor, action, and heart.
Po's victory is so satisfying because he earns it by being himself.
The film is a visual treat with a wonderful story.
The final 'skadoosh' is the perfect ending to a perfect hero's journey.
The characters are what make this movie so special.
The Dragon Scroll twist is one of the best in any animated film.
A classic that will be loved for generations.
Tai Lung getting defeated by the very thing he sought is perfect irony.
